lines.text: You know, she goes for me in a big way, Pete. If the boss wasn't chasin' every skirt in the blue book, I'd have some chance to see her.
Say, what's that you got under your arm, there, Helen? Music?
Ah-huh. We're having an Opportunity Contest at Roseland tonight and everybody with a voice will be given a chance to sing over the radio.
Gee, I'd love to hear you sing it.
Oh, but, I'm nervous about going on the air.
Don't worry. The boss won't be down. He always takes his time.
Oh, isn't it gorgeous in here. Fit for a king.
Yeah, but this one sees more queens.
Bored?
Not bored. Simply craving something new. Any environment, but the Avenue.
An innovation such as you infer, necessarily means women. May I have a cigarette, Jack?
Come on Les. We can't go right, but, we won't go wrong.
Roseland, Roseland. My country right or wrong.
This is Opportunity Night. Tickets inside. Roseland, ladies and gentlemen, 150 hostesses.
Oh, I just gotta see you Marty.
Hey, listen, why don't you lay off of me.
Now, now don't talk to me like that. You know you're the only one!
Aw, quite handin' me that stuff. You and me is washed up.

Let me give you the low down on that rock. This here ruby come from far off Bombay. A Hindu prince sold it to an Arabian Sheik in Shanghai. I hears about it when we ship docked in Singapore. I traced it way back in New Orleans where it was bought up by an American millionaire. I makes up to him and buys it. And I wouldn't give you that, would I sweetie, if I didn't think the world of you.

[laughs]
That American millionaire must have been Mr. Woolworth.
They're playing a song that I have to sing tonight and I'm a little nervous.
Oh, you sing?
Well, I hope the radio fans will think so.
Well, I'm a good listener. How about rehearsing a bit of it right now?
Are you sure you don't mind?
No. Go ahead. If you do half as much for my ears as you've done to my eyes, I'll be dancing on clouds.
Gee, I thought that only happened in pictures!
